detaileddescription.para: Note: The default message type is unconfirmed.

Provide the LoRaWAN stack with a function to be called whenever a battery level needs to be read. As per LoRaWAN specification the callback needs to return "0: node is connected to an external power source, 1..254: battery level, where 1 is the minimum and 254 is the maximum value, 255: the node was not able to measure the battery level"
Should no callback be provided the lorawan backend will report 255.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the battery level function

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

briefdescription.para: Register a callback to be run on downlink packets.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to structure containing callback parameters

briefdescription.para: Register a callback to be called when the datarate changes.

detaileddescription.para: The callback is called once upon successfully joining a network and again each time the datarate changes due to ADR.

The callback function takes one parameter:
dr - updated datarate
Join the LoRaWAN network using OTAA or AWB.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

detaileddescription.para: This function need to be called before joining the network.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, uint8_t *data, uint8_t len, uint8_t flags)
memberdef.name: lorawan_send

briefdescription.para: Send data to the LoRaWAN network.

detaileddescription.para: Send data to the connected LoRaWAN network.

parameterdescription.para: Port to be used for sending data. Must be set if the payload is not empty.
Length of the buffer to be sent. Maximum length of this buffer is 255 bytes but the actual payload size varies with region and datarate.
Flag used to determine the type of message being sent. It could be one of the lorawan_message_type. The default behaviour is unconfirmed message.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

detaileddescription.para: Change the current device class. This function may be called before or after a network connection has been established.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

briefdescription.para: Set the number of tries used for transmissions.

parameterdescription.para: Number of tries to be used

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

detaileddescription.para: Control whether adaptive data rate (ADR) is enabled. When ADR is enabled, the data rate is treated as a default data rate that will be used if the ADR algorithm has not established a data rate. ADR should normally only be enabled for devices with stable RF conditions (i.e., devices in a mostly static location).

parameterdescription.para: Enable or Disable adaptive data rate.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, negative errno code if failure

detaileddescription.para: The minimum possible datarate may change in response to a TxParamSetupReq command from the network server.
Query the current payload sizes. The maximum payload size varies with datarate, while the current payload size can be less due to MAC layer commands which are inserted into uplink packets.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum payload size for the next transmission
Maximum payload size for this datarate
